name: Step 1: Adjust the string length
description: Unravel the yo-yo, so it rests on the floor. The string should reach your belly button. If it's too long, cut it where it meets the bottom of your chest when the yo-yo is resting on the floor.

name: Step 2: Tie a loop
description: Tie a loop at the end of the string, so that the string is the proper length.

name: Step 3: Wind the yo-yo
description: Hold the yo-yo with your left hand, your index finger over the slot in the yo-yo. Wind the string one time around both the yo-yo and your finger. Then remove your finger and wind the rest of the string around the yo-yo.

name: Step 4: Loop your finger
description: Place the loop on your middle finger, between your first and second knuckles.

name: Tip
description: Use your dominant hand to yo-yo, which will give you more control.

name: Step 5: Hold the yo-yo
description: Hold the yo-yo in your hand, palm up, so that the string goes from your finger over the top to the yo-yo.

name: Step 6: Throw the yo-yo
description: Throw the yo-yo forward and downward, opening with your hand open wide and facing your palm outward.

name: Step 7: Turn your hand and tug the string
description: Turn your hand over so that your palm is facing the floor and sharply tug the string the second the sting is fully extended.

name: Step 8: Catch the yo-yo
description: Catch the yo-yo in the palm of your hand, turn it over and repeat. You are now successfully yo-yoing. Keep practicing!

name: Did You Know?
description: Did you know? The yo-yo did not make its way to the U.S. until 1916, even though its history extends back to 500 B.C.E.
